oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hank Snow Conversation with Friends
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording contains an interview between an intoxicated Hank Snow, Robert Russell "Chubby or Tubby" Wise, George Swift, and James "Jimmie" Hyde. The tape is dated November 2, 1955. This tape is thirty-four of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Chubby Wise; George Swift; James Hyde
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Part of an unidentified song (Unidentified) -- (00:15) Hank Snow turns on recording -- (00:38) Snow asks Margaret about the show -- (01:17) Snow introduces Chubby Wise -- (01:28) Wise thanks everyone -- (01:57) Wise recites crude poetry -- (03:09) Snow and Wise talk about where Wise works -- (04:15) The men talk about working in the Rainbow Room -- (05:06) Snow and Wise introduce George Swift -- (05:22) Swift talks about the evening -- (05:57) Snow and Swift talk about where Swift is from and his act -- (07:04) Snow and Wise introduce James Hyde -- (07:48) Hyde thanks everyone -- (07:54) Men discuss beer and other random topics -- (08:43) Men discuss how to close the recording -- (09:31) Hyde and Snow say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank; Wise, Chubby;
